definitions.definition: To commit to (some action or outcome), or to assure (a person) of such commitment; to make an oath or vow .
examples: If you promise not to tell anyone, I will let you have this cake for free.
She promised to never return to this town again.
He promised me a big kiss if I would drive him to the airport.
I can't promise success, but I'll do the best I can.

definitions.definition: To give grounds for expectation , especially of something good.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive , ditransitive ) To commit to (some action or outcome), or to assure (a person) of such commitment; to make an oath or vow .
secondary_definitions: ( ambitransitive ) To give grounds for expectation , especially of something good.
